chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Colburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child AMENDED FROM 1ST DEGREE CHILD SEXUAL ASSAULT, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with sex offender registry. Sex offender treatment program and comply with recommendations. Community based sex offender treatment and AODA assessment with Dr. Kotkin is acceptable as long as the assessment does not require a more intense or controlled setting. No contact with the victims A.J.S., R.M.S. or A.J.B. (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co defendants M.S. or S.H. May not use the Internet including social media unless approved by agent. No contact with any minors under the age of 16 unless approved by agent. Must reside with grandparents once released. Extended supervision maybe transfered to Milwaukee County. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

AMENDED 08-17-2017: Community based sex offender treatment and AODA assessment with Dr. Kotkin is acceptable as long as the assessment does not require a more intense or controlled setting but treatment with this specific provider is not required to fulfill this condition. Must be released to Racine County per requirements of state statute. Extended supervision may be transferred to Milwaukee County if requested by defendant and approved per statutory requirements. If transfer is approved, must reside with grandparents.

It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.
**AMENDED 7/15/2016 to add restitution.**

**AMENDED 9/28/2015 Bond modification granted: GPS to be removed. All previous conditions to remain.
***Amended 8/7/15 Must reside at 1902 E Jarvis Street Shorewood, WI 53211 with his grandparents Douglas and Rose Colburn and may attend school in Shorewood WI.****  No contact with the victims, AJS and RMS (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant, MS. No contact w/anyone under the age of 18yrs old without adult supervision.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Defendant may leave home with a Grandparent, or for court, attorney appointments and medical/counseling/evaluation appointments.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Defendant must stay out of the City/Town of Burlington, Wis. Defendant may not use any social media at all, and no communication with anyone - oral or written - about this case. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing randomly and after each court appearance.
